alert.note: Alert for Greater Greenville; Greenville Mountains; Laurens; Spartanburg; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 3:18AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...BANDS OF SNOW PRODUCING LOW VISIBILITY AND TRAVEL IMPACTS EARLY THIS MORNING... Small but intense bands of snowfall are being observed across portions of the North Carolina mountains and foothills, and extending into a portion of Upstate South Carolina, specifically areas along the Interstate 26 corridor. These bands may produce rapid accumulation of up to an inch of snow, while also severely restricting visibility. Drivers should be extra alert early this morning and be prepared to encounter short stretches of snow covered roads and visibility as low as a quarter mile. The snow bands should diminish before daybreak.
